examples.text: There are only three cookies left.
three of Sweden’s top financial experts
Ten people were invited but only three turned up.
Can you lend me three dollars?
I can't read your writing—is this meant to be a three?
The bulbs are planted in threes or fives *(= groups of three or five)*.
We moved to America when I was three *(= three years old)*.
Shall we meet at three *(= at three o'clock)*, then?

definitions.definition: two or three at a time; in small numbers

examples.text: People arrived in twos and threes.

definitions.definition: reading, writing and arithmetic, thought to be the most important parts of a child’s education

wordOrigin: Old English thrīe (masculine), thrīo, thrēo (feminine), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch drie and German drei, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin tres and Greek treis.
